title: CDROM loader once booted from HD

forumNotes.author: sebus
forumNotes.content:
Does anybody know a solution to my issue?  

Truecrypt encrypted system partition (with known password \& Rescue CD available)  

Ofcourse I can boot the system as normal with Truecrypt loader \& boot authentication  

I can boot WinPE CD \& then use portable Truecrypt \& make the partition available  

But what I want/need is to use Truecrypt loader with authentication \& then instead of carry on booting from HD, carry on with booting from CD (like Hiren's or WinPE etc)  

So I would need an entry added in Windows boot loader boot.ini that carries on with boot from CD   
I hoped that Plop could do it, but it only works with IDE drives (and most new systems do have SATA these days)  

The CD bootloaders allow carry booting from HD, but I need to have the situation reversed  

Thanks for any suggestions  

sebus

forumNotes.content:

Thanks you, that should work, as long as the CD drive is ... NOT SATA (but the same applied to Plop)

Thanks again. As it turned out, for Truecrypt to work PBA is not the only thing that is needed, so what I wanted to get going (and I did with pure ATAPI drive in the end) simply does not work (but I did learn something in the process...)
